Claude's Sonnet 4.5 has access to up-to-date information, but is considerably more expensive per output (nearly $1 per ticker). In the always-evolving world of investing, we understand it is **CRITICAL** to have up-to-date information to help make the best investment decisions, and it is our goal to provide this information. But considering there are thousands of companies that we would ideally be updating monthly, as well as future goals of also providing quick and digestible summaries and insights for newly released earnings and conference calls, breaking news, FED speeches, etc, this quickly becomes very costly.

For this reason, please consider **subscribing to our Patreon** or donating to enable QuickTick AI to provide as much value and up-to-date insight as possible to **allow you to make the most informed investment decisions with a level of efficiency not possible even a few years ago.** 100% of the funds will go straight to purchasing more API credits to continue expanding our high quality, up-to-date analysis for more and more companies, and further then into our future value-generating plans. Thanks! - QuickTick AI

# International Seaways, Inc. (INSW) Sell-Side Analysis Report

## Company Overview
International Seaways, Inc. (INSW), headquartered in New York City, is a leading independent tanker company specializing in the global seaborne transportation of crude oil and refined petroleum products. Formed in 2014 as a spin-off from OSG and expanded via the 2021 merger with Diamond S Shipping, INSW operates one of the world's largest fleets of mid-to-large-sized tankers, totaling 81 wholly owned vessels as of June 30, 2024. This includes 11 Very Large Crude Carriers (VLCCs), 13 Suezmaxes, 8 Aframaxes, 7 LR2s, 30 Medium Range (MR) product tankers, and 12 LR1s/Handysize. The company generates revenue primarily through time charter equivalent (TCE) contracts, with a mix of spot market exposure (about 60-70% of earnings) via pools like the Scorpio MR Pool and 5Pool, and fixed-rate charters for stability. INSW serves a diverse customer base of oil majors, refiners, and traders, capitalizing on geopolitical disruptions (e.g., Red Sea attacks since October 2023) and supply constraints that have driven tanker rates to multi-year highs. With a focus on fleet modernization, shareholder returns via dividends ($0.12/share quarterly) and buybacks ($100M+ authorized in 2024), and a low net debt of $98.6M (as of Q2 2024), INSW is positioned as a high free-cash-flow generator in a cyclical sector. (198 words)

## Recent Developments
- **August 1, 2024**: Reported Q2 2024 earnings – TCE revenues $365.6M (vs. $222.4M YoY), Adjusted EBITDA $195.2M (vs. $117.0M), net income $112.9M or $2.07/share (vs. $68.1M). Fleetwide TCE rate averaged $45,639/day.
- **September 10, 2024**: Sold two older MR tankers (built 2005/2006) for $29M total gross proceeds; part of ongoing fleet optimization.
- **July 2024**: Repurchased 1.1M shares for $55M under ongoing program; total repurchases YTD ~$150M.
- **October 2023 – Ongoing**: Red Sea/Houthi disruptions boosted VLCC/Suezmax rates; INSW's spot exposure yielded windfall profits.
- **Q3 2024 Earnings Preview (Upcoming Nov 7, 2024)**: Analysts expect continued strength from high rates, though product tanker weakness emerging.

## Growth Strategy
- **Fleet Renewal**: Acquired two eco-VLCCs (2024 delivery) and one scrubber-fitted Suezmax in 2024; targeting younger, efficient vessels to lower OPEX and comply with IMO 2020/2050 emissions rules.
- **Capital Allocation**: 50% FCF to dividends/buybacks, 30% debt reduction, 20% growth capex; $238M liquidity as of Q2 2024.
- **Spot + Charter Mix**: Maintain 60% spot for upside capture, 40% fixed for downside protection; active in commercial pools for scale.
- **Expansion Focus**: Opportunistic M&A in tankers; emphasis on crude oil segment amid low orderbook (3.5% of fleet).

## Company and Sector Headwinds & Tailwinds

| Category | Tailwinds | Headwinds |
|----------|-----------|-----------|
| **Company-Specific** | Strong balance sheet (0.1x Net Debt/EBITDA); high FCF ($300M+ annualized); active buybacks enhancing EPS. | Aging fleet segments (avg. 9.5 years); exposure to volatile spot rates (60%+). |
| **Sector-Wide** | Geopolitics (Red Sea +20-30% ton-miles; Russia sanctions); OPEC cuts tightening crude supply; low newbuild orderbook (VLCC: 5% of fleet). Tanker rates: VLCC $50k+/day (Oct 2024). | Potential rate normalization post-2025; product tanker oversupply (MR deliveries +10% fleet in 2025); regulatory costs (EU ETS, CII). |

## Existing Products/Services
- **Core Offering**: Ocean transportation of crude oil (VLCC/Suezmax/Aframax: ~45% fleet) and clean petroleum products (MR/LR1/LR2: ~55%).
- **Commercial Structure**: Spot via pools (e.g., 5Pool for Suezmax/VLCC, Scorpio MR); time charters (avg. 1-3 years).
- **Value-Add**: Technical management in-house; scrubbers on 100% of crude fleet for fuel flexibility.

## New Products/Services/Projects
- **Eco-Fleet Upgrades**: Two LNG-dual fuel VLCC newbuilds on order (delivery 2027, $260M total cost, 50% financed); improves efficiency 30%+.
- **Digital Initiatives**: AI route optimization pilots (announced Q1 2024) to cut fuel by 5%.
- **No Major New Segments**: Sticking to tankers; monitoring chemical tanker adjacency.

## Market Share Approximations & Forecast
- **Current (2024)**: Crude tankers ~4-5% global VLCC capacity (11/250 active); ~6% Suezmax (13/200); top-10 product tankers (~3% MR fleet).
- **Forecast**: Stable-to-growing to 5-7% by 2026 via renewals/acquisitions; crude share up on low orderbook, products flat amid competition. Sector growth: +2-3% tonnage demand annually.

## Comparison to Competitors
| Metric (Q2 2024 or Latest) | INSW | Frontline (FRO) | Scorpio (STNG) | DHT Holdings (DHT) |
|----------------------------|------|-----------------|---------------|-------------------|
| **Fleet Size**            | 81   | 81 (mostly VLCC)| 130 (products)| 27 (VLCC)        |
| **Avg. Vessel Age**       | 9.5y | 8.2y            | 8.9y          | 9.1y              |
| **Q2 Adj. EBITDA**        | $195M| $320M           | $310M         | $118M             |
| **Net Debt**              | $99M | $850M           | $700M         | $30M              |
| **Spot Exposure**         | 60%  | 40%             | 70%           | 90%               |
| **Edge**                  | Balanced fleet/debt | Scale in VLCC  | Products upside| Pure VLCC purity  |

INSW differentiates via diversified fleet, lowest leverage.

## Partnerships, M&A
- **Partnerships**: Scorpio Group pools (MR/products); 5Pool (crude); technical ties with ABS for vessel inspections.
- **M&A**: 2021 $2.1B merger with Diamond S (accretive); no major 2024 deals, but CEO open to "transformational" opportunities (Aug 2024 call).

## Current and Potential Major Clients
- **Current**: Spot market dominant; key charterers include ExxonMobil, Shell, Trafigura, Vitol (per earnings calls).
- **Potential**: Niche growth with Middle East producers (Aramco) amid Asia exports; LNG carrier crossovers via eco-VLCCs.

## Other Qualitative Measures
- **ESG**: 100% scrubber-equipped crude fleet; targeting net-zero by 2050; strong board diversity.
- **Management**: CEO Lois Zabrocky (since 2014) lauded for capital discipline; insider ownership 1.5%.
- **Risks**: Cyclicality (beta 1.8); FX/interest rate exposure minimal.

## Valuation & Recommendation
- **Latest Stock Price (Oct 11, 2024 close)**: $54.86 (Yahoo Finance/Google Finance).
- **Market Capitalization**: $2.72B (81.7M shares outstanding).
- **Buy Rating**: **8/10 (Strong Buy)** – High FCF yield (15%+), tanker bull market tailwinds outweigh cycle risks; hold for moderate risk/growth.
- **Estimated Fair Value**: $68/share (24% upside) – Based on 6x 2025E EV/EBITDA ($1.8B forward EBITDA at $40k/day rates); DCF supports $65-72 range assuming 10% IRR, moderate risk (peer avg. multiple 7x).
